summary: This is an email chain between attorneys discussing a letter sent to Judge Rakoff regarding Leon Black. The correspondence involves scheduling and confidentiality concerns about an exhibit containing highly confidential information.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Attorney at Wigdor Law who is inquiring about a review of materials sent by Jeanne Christensen and requesting a time to connect.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Partner at Wigdor Law who sent a confidential letter to Judge Rakoff regarding Leon Black and is corresponding about its contents.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the confidential letter sent to Judge Rakoff, discussed among the attorneys.

persons.name: Judge Rakoff
persons.context: The judge to whom a confidential letter regarding Leon Black was sent.

connections.description: Colleagues at Wigdor Law firm coordinating on legal matters related to Leon Black.
Christensen is involved in legal correspondence (a letter to a judge) concerning Leon Black.
Wigdor is discussing follow-ups and questions related to materials about Leon Black.

events.title: Letter Sent to Judge Rakoff
events.description: A letter regarding Leon Black was sent to Judge Rakoff, containing a highly confidential exhibit.

events.title: Attorney Discussion on Leon Black Matter
events.description: Douglas Wigdor and Jeanne M. Christensen had a conversation about the Leon Black case, leading to the sharing of the confidential letter.

keyFacts: A confidential letter regarding Leon Black was sent to Judge Rakoff on Friday, March 1, 2024.
Exhibit C of the letter is described as containing 'highly confidential information'.
The correspondence is between attorneys at Wigdor Law firm discussing the review and follow-up on this legal matter.
The email chain highlights attorney-client privilege and confidentiality concerns surrounding the Leon Black case.
